content: Your user type has been changed to <1>“{{userType}}”</1> by the {{productName}} admin <1>{{adminName}}</1>.

comment.text: This translation key displays a message when a user's type changes, indicating the new user type and who made the change. It is used in a modal dialog to notify users of an administrative action taken by the admin.

usage.context:
<ModalDialog.Header>{t("Common:Warning")}</ModalDialog.Header>
 <ModalDialog.Body>
 <Trans
 t={t}
 ns="Files"
 i18nKey="YourUserTypeHasChanged"
 values={{
 userType: t("Common:Guest"),
 productName: t("Common:ProductName"),
 adminName,
 }}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Arabic translation uses « » instead of “ ”. This may not be the preferred style for the product and should be consistent with the English original, which uses “ ”.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace « » with “ ”.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "olaraq dəyişdirilib" doesn't accurately convey "has been changed to." A more natural translation would be something like "dəyişdirilmişdir" or "olub".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: İstifadəçi tipiniz {{productName}} administratoru <1>{{adminName}}</1> tərəfindən <1>“{{userType}}”</1> dəyişdirilmişdir.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The order of the tags <1> and the content within them seems reversed compared to the English original.  The '“{{userType}}”' should be *before* the closing tag.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: İstifadəçi tipiniz {{productName}} administratoru <1>{{adminName}}</1> tərəfindən <1>“{{userType}}”</1> dəyişdirilib.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "in <1>”{{userType}}”</1> geändert" is not the most natural way to express "changed to {{userType}}". A more fluent translation would use a preposition that better conveys the change.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ihr Benutzertyp wurde vom {{productName}}-Administrator <1>{{adminName}}</1> auf <1>”{{userType}}”</1> geändert.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The German translation uses 'auf' followed by the user type within quotes, mirroring the English formatting. While not inherently wrong, maintaining consistency is preferable.  Consider removing/adjusting the surrounding quotes for consistency, if the application supports it.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ihr Benutzertyp wurde vom {{productName}}-Administrator <1>{{adminName}}</1> auf {{userType}} geändert.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Greek translation retains the angle brackets (<1> and </1>) which are present in the English original. These tags are likely intended for internal processing and should be removed from the final displayed text in the Greek version. They are unnecessary and disrupt the flow of the sentence.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the <1> and </1> tags from the Greek translation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'Su tipo de usuario se ha cambiado a' is not the most natural way to express 'Your user type has been changed to' in Spanish. A more common and fluent translation would be 'Su tipo de usuario fue cambiado a'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Su tipo de usuario fue cambiado a

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "käyttäjätyypiksesi" is a literal translation of "your user type". A more natural Finnish phrasing would be something like "sinun käyttäjätyyppisi" or simply "käyttäjätyyppisi".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: käyttäjätyyppisi

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "on vaihtanut" is slightly awkward. A more common phrasing for 'has changed' in this context would be 'on muuttanut'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: on muuttanut

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The placement of the opening and closing tags for 'adminName' and 'userType' might be inconsistent with the English source. While not strictly an error, it's worth reviewing for consistency.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Review tag placement for consistency with English source.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Votre type d'utilisateur a été modifié en" is somewhat literal and could be improved for naturalness in French. A more common phrasing would be "Votre type d'utilisateur a été changé en" or "Votre type d'utilisateur est maintenant".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Votre type d'utilisateur a été changé en

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'by the {{productName}} admin' is translated awkwardly.  'ադմին' is a direct transliteration of 'admin' and while understandable, a more natural Armenian equivalent for 'admin' in this context would be preferable.  Consider a term like 'գործակալ' (agent) or similar depending on the specific role.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider translating 'ադմին' to a more appropriate Armenian term for 'admin' based on the specific role (e.g., 'գործակալ').

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The '<1>...</1>' tags are present in the Armenian translation but are likely unnecessary and disrupt the readability. These are likely placeholders from the original source and don’t need to be included in the final translation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the '<1>...</1>' tags from the Armenian translation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The `<1>` tags are inconsistent. The opening tag “<1>” is present in both the English and Italian versions, but closing tags are missing in the English version. The Italian translation retains the opening tag but doesn't include the closing tag in the second instance.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure both opening and closing tags `<1>` are present and consistent in both versions, if the intent is to mark specific text for formatting.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "によって" (niyotte) is grammatically correct but sounds overly formal and indirect in this context. A more natural phrasing would be something like "から" (kara) or a more active voice construction.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: あなたのユーザータイプは、{{productName}}管理者<1>{{adminName}}</1>から<1>“{{userType}}”</1>に変更されました。

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The placement of the `<1>` tags seems incorrect in relation to the Japanese content. They should mirror the English, meaning the closing tag for '{{adminName}}' should be before the closing tag for “{{userType}}”.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: あなたのユーザータイプは、{{productName}}管理者<1>{{adminName}}</1>によって<1>“{{userType}}”</1>に変更されました。 should be あなたのユーザータイプは、{{productName}}管理者<1>{{adminName}}</1>によって<1>“{{userType}}”</1>に変更されました。 The formatting of the tags are not aligned with the English and should be reconsidered.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation retains the XML-like tags (<1> and </1>) from the English content. These tags are not standard in Lao and should be removed unless they serve a specific, intended purpose.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the tags <1> and </1> from the Lao translation. The translated text should read: "ປະເພດຜູ້ໃຊ້ຂອງທ່ານໄດ້ຖືກປ່ຽນເປັນ “{{userType}}” ໂດຍຜູ້ບໍລິຫານ {{productName}} {{adminName}}."

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Your user type has been changed to" is not accurately reflected in the translation. "ir mainījis jūsu lietotāja tipu uz" translates more literally to "has changed your user type to". It lacks the passive voice of the original.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a phrasing like "Jūsu lietotāja tips ir ticis mainīts uz" which more closely aligns with the original passive construction. Alternatively, "Jūsu lietotāja tipu ir mainījis..." is also acceptable.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The `<1>` tags are present in the translation and should ideally be consistent with the English source.  While likely placeholders, their presence indicates a potential formatting issue if they are meant to be removed or have different usage in the target language.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Review the intended function of the `<1>` tags and ensure consistency with the source language's usage.  They may need to be removed entirely depending on the system's processing.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Portuguese translation maintains the HTML tags <1> as in the English, which isn't standard practice for user-facing messages in Portuguese. The tags should be removed for a cleaner and more natural flow.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: O seu tipo de utilizador foi alterado para “{{userType}}” pelo administrador {{productName}} {{adminName}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, 'pelo administrador {{productName}}' is a slightly awkward phrasing. A more natural Portuguese phrasing would be 'pelo administrador do {{productName}}' to specify *whose* admin it is.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: O seu tipo de utilizador foi alterado para “{{userType}}” pelo administrador do {{productName}} {{adminName}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The `<1>` tags are inconsistently applied. The second `<1>` tag should also have a closing `</1>`.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure all `<1>` tags have corresponding `</1>` tags for consistent formatting.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Romanian phrase 'de către' might sound slightly awkward in this context. It's a literal translation of 'by'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider rephrasing to something like 'de' or 'din partea lui' depending on desired tone and flow, although 'de către' is technically correct. e.g., 'de' administratorul al...'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "ඔබේ පරිශීලක වර්ගය" (obae parisheelaka vargaya) translates more accurately to 'Your user type' rather than a more literal translation. While understandable, it could be improved.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider rephrasing to something like "ඔබේ පරිශීලකත්වය" (obae parisheelakathva) which means 'Your user status/profile' for a more natural flow.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word "ලේසින්" (lesin) used with the phrase "ඔබේ පරිශීලක වර්ගය" sounds a bit archaic and formal for a notification. It translates to 'as' or 'by means of'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace "ලේසින්" with a more common and less formal word like "durch" (through) or a more concise phrasing that removes the preposition altogether.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The XML-like tags <1> ... </1> are not standard in Sinhala text and might not be rendered correctly. They don't serve a clear purpose in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the tags <1> and </1> from the Sinhala translation. The surrounding content should be treated as plain text.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation of "changed to" is awkward. "spremenil v" implies someone changed something *into* something, rather than the user's type being changed *to* a new type. A more natural translation would be something like "bil spremenjen na" or "postal".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Vaš tip uporabnika je bil spremenjen na <1>”{{userType}}“</1> skrbnik za {{productName}} <1>{{adminName}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The quotation marks and angle brackets are inconsistent with the English version and could be improved for better readability and consistency.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Vaš tip uporabnika je bil spremenjen na <1>”{{userType}}“</1> skrbnik za {{productName}} <1>{{adminName}}</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The closing tag for `adminName` is incorrect. It should be `</1>`, matching the opening tag `</1>`.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change `</1>` to `</1>`

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The `<1>` tags are not consistently formatted. The closing tag has an extra space after the `/`.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent formatting of the `<1>` tags, e.g., `<1>` and `</1>`.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While understandable, "promenjen na" could be improved for a more natural flow. "promenjen u" or "postavljen na" might be better alternatives depending on the intended nuance.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using "promenjen u" or "postavljen na" instead of "promenjen na".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'Your user type has been changed to' is not accurately translated.  'olayk' (as used in 'olarak değiştirildi') implies 'into' or 'to be'. A more natural and accurate translation would be something like 'Kullanıcı türünüz... olarak güncellendi' (Your user type... has been updated to).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Kullanıcı türünüz, {{productName}} yöneticisi <1>{{adminName}}</1> tarafından <1>“{{userType}}”</1> olarak güncellendi.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The formatting of the angle brackets <1> and </1> appears consistent but it's important to verify that this formatting will be handled correctly in the target platform/application.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Confirm that the <1> and </1> tags are correctly interpreted and rendered in the target application. Consider alternative formatting if needed.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Ukrainian translation uses angled brackets (<1>...</1>) instead of double quotes for the content enclosed by the tags, which seems inconsistent with the English version. It's unclear if this is intentional or a mistake.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider whether to align with English format:  "Ваш тип користувача змінено на <1>"{{userType}}"</1>" адміністратором {{productName}} <1>{{adminName}}</1>."

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Loại người dùng của bạn đã được...thay đổi thành" is a bit awkward. A more natural phrasing would be something like "Loại người dùng của bạn đã được...đổi thành" or "Quyền người dùng của bạn đã được...thay đổi thành".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Loại người dùng của bạn đã được quản trị viên {{adminName}} của {{productName}} đổi thành <1>“{{userType}}”</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'quản trị viên' directly translates to 'admin'. While technically correct, depending on the target audience, a more specific or formal term might be more appropriate.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using a more formal term for 'admin' depending on the audience, such as 'người quản lý hệ thống' or 'người điều hành'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation of "Your user type has been changed to" is awkward. A more natural phrasing would be "您的用户类型已更改为" or "您的用户类型已修改为".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 您的用户类型已更改为

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The placement of the brackets <1> ... </1> is inconsistent with the English source. While they are present, they don't clearly reflect the English structure, particularly concerning the quotes around {{userType}}.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure the placement of the brackets mirrors the original English. For instance, if the quotes are essential in the English, they should be in the Chinese as well.
